definition: a single spark (idiom); an insignificant cause can have a massive effect
star/heavenly body/satellite/small amount
star/heavenly body/satellite/small amount
(possessive particle, literary equivalent of 的[de5])/him/her/it
fire/urgent/ammunition/fiery or flaming/internal heat (Chinese medicine)/hot (popular)/classifier for military units (old)/Kangxi radical 86
surname Huo
a single spark can start a huge blaze (idiom); an insignificant cause can have a massive effect
pinyin: xing1 xing5 zhi1 huo3 , ke3 yi3 liao2 yuan2

sentences.english: A little fire is quickly trodden out, which, being suffered, rivers cannot quench.
sentences.chinese: 星星之火一旦燎原，则江河之水难扑灭。

sentences.english: Just like fire, burnin' up the way.
sentences.chinese: 就如同星星之火，顺势燎原。

sentences.english: At first it was but a lurid spark upon the stone pavement .
sentences.chinese: 起先，那只是闪现在石板路上的灰黄色的星星之火。

sentences.english: Once it starts the autoimmunity going, it is like lighting a fire and over time the disease develops.
sentences.chinese: 当自身免疫进程开始，就像星星之火，疾病不断进展。

sentences.english: The spark was, as ever, unanticipated.
sentences.chinese: 星星之火的点燃从来都是不可预知的。

definition: to start a prairie fire
a single spark can start a huge blaze (idiom); an insignificant cause can have a massive effect
pinyin: xing1 xing5 zhi1 huo3 , ke3 yi3 liao2 yuan2

definition: to ignite/to light/fig. to spark off (hopes, controversy, flames of revolution)
spark/meteor trail (mostly used in expressions like 急如星火[ji2 ru2 xing1 huo3])
to ignite/to set on fire/aflame
to stop burning/to go out (of fire)/to die out/extinguished
to blossom everywhere/to spring up all over the place/to flourish on a large scale
fire beacons on all sides (idiom); enveloped in the flames of war
fire beacon (used as alarm signal over long distance)
vigorous/flourishing/full of vitality
wildfire/(spreading like) wildfire/bush fire/farm fire (for clearing fields)
to illuminate/to light up/lighting
to rise abruptly (to a towering position)/to tower over/to spring up/to emerge suddenly/the emergence (e.g. of a power)
a torch/CL:把[ba3]
to extend/to spread
when everybody gathers fuel, the flames are higher (idiom)/the more people, the more strength
pinyin: zhong4 ren2 shi2 chai2 huo3 yan4 gao1
